summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 discussing logistical arrangements for FBI victim specialists to meet with potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein in Florida. The emails, which include a thread from July 2019, coordinate interview schedules and locations (West Palm Beach and Miami) for victim services following Epstein's 2019 arrest.

persons.name: M.S.C.J.
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist based at the Miami Headquarters and Homestead Resident Agency, who signs off the email with a confidentiality notice.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: FBI agents scheduled interviews with potential Epstein victims at 11 AM and 3 PM, with logistical planning for victim specialist meetings in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Case Agent Travel to Florida
events.description: An FBI Case Agent was reported to be traveling to Florida for interviews with potential Epstein victims scheduled for the following day.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim services and interviews for potential Epstein victims in Florida in July 2019, shortly after his arrest.
Interviews with victims were scheduled for July 11, 2019, at 11 AM and 3 PM, with a focus on the West Palm Beach area.
The correspondence highlights the FBI's victim specialist program and the logistical planning involved in providing services to alleged victims.
The email chain includes a standard FBI confidentiality notice regarding the protection of Personally Identifiable Information (PII).
The document indicates ongoing investigative activity and victim outreach in the Epstein case during mid-2019.
